page.title: 03HARLINGTON UPPER SCHOOL.
page.content: The school was founded in 1974 and moved to the buildings it now occupies in 1975.There were 208 pupils and 16 staff to begin with.This has grown to 70 staff and 954 pupils.These pupils come from 32 different settlements in Bedfordshire. The 1985 entry will be divided into nine forms. The timetable operates using a ten day cycle of 8 periods a day.In the first year the children have:10 periods each of English,Mathematics,Languages.Humaniti es12 periods,Science13 periods,Craft subjects 8 periods,P.E./Games 6 periods, Personal guidance 3 periods and Arts:Music 4 periods each.During this first year each pupil chooses options for the future course to follow.The school is taking part in the Technical and Vocational Education Initiative.
